New Records: Florian Wirtz became Germany's youngest scorer in European Championship history
Key Match Events: Florian Wirtz scored in the 10th minute
Jamal Musiala scored in the 19th minute
Kai Havertz scored a penalty in the 45'+1'
Niclas Füllkrug scored in the 68th minute
Antonio Rüdiger scored an own goal in the 87th minute
Post-Match Reflections: Germany captain Ílkay Gündogan said, 'We played with a lot of intensity and played the right spaces, took some risks, and that is why we scored. We played an outstanding first half and we were up 3-0.'

Scotland captain Andy Robertson said, 'First half, we just got it all wrong really, didn't show up, weren't aggressive enough, and we let good players get on the ball. Second half, we're down to 10 men and I thought the lads dug in really well. We have to bounce back quickly because there was lots wrong here and it's a quick turnaround now.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Scotland lost defender Ryan Porteous for a studs-up challenge on Gündogan that earned the hosts their penalty
Julian Nagelsmann's Germany next face Hungary on Wednesday before taking on Switzerland in their final Group A match
The Scots, who did not have one effort on or off target, pulled a goal back in the 87th minute when Rüdiger headed the ball into his own net
